instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01949: What is 820-01949? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message:
Motherboard <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v - 0.03A(3ports) after water damage, 1 port doesn't power up.
CD3217B12 were taken from a donor
goal: get user data
Please advise.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message: Do you mean that USB meter stays black one port?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message:
One of the ports works only one side of the type-c. Pictures attached.
We found small corrosion inside the connector on the motherboard. Pictures attached.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message: Compare diode mode readings on CC1/2 lines of all ports.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message:
I specified lot of times; do NOT post "V" if we talk about diode mode!

What 0V means there?
Is that short to ground, or OL?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message:
Diode mode
<SIGNAL>USBC_R_CC1</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_T_CC1</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_W_CC1</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_X_CC1</SIGNAL> - 0.7

<SIGNAL>USBC_R_CC2</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_T_CC2</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_W_CC2</SIGNAL> - 0.7
<SIGNAL>USBC_X_CC2</SIGNAL> - 0.16

Previous post measurements was Voltages with powered motherboard at the corresponding connectors.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message: Major Tom to ground control, change the <SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL> chip ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01949</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-07 stuck at 5v.
threads.message: If no other bad readings around <SIGNAL>U3100_X</SIGNAL>,  remove DZ3301 first.
